title: Boy, 4, dies in shooting at KC home
content:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. —
Police said they're investigating the shooting death of a 4-year-old boy in Kansas City early Saturday.
Officers said they were called to a home in the 400 block of North Elmwood Avenue about 7 a.m. and found a woman outside, holding the injured boy in her arms.
He was taken to a hospital, where he died.
A long time friend of the family said the boy's name is Jesse.
She said she was inside the home when the shooting happened. She said she awoke to screams.
"My baby is gone and he ain't coming back. So I'm heartbroken. He was like a son to me," family friend Monique Smith.
Police said they are questioning the boy's mother and her boyfriend about the incident. They said they believe the shooting happened inside the house, but they have not released additional information about it.
